title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.7: MULTI COUNTRY - WASH

description.narrative: Output 2.7: Multi Country - WASH Communities, schools and health centers use improved water and sanitation facilities with a focus on outer islands, rural and peri-urban villages

mailing-address.narrative: 3rd & 5th Floors FDB Building 360 Victoria Parade Suva

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.7: Multi Country - WASH Communities, schools and health centers use improved water and sanitation facilities with a focus on outer islands, rural and peri-urban villages

description.narrative: WASH in Schools programmes were expanded in Fiji, Vanuatu, Kiribati and Solomon Islands and introduced in the Federated States of Micronesia, support was provided in Fiji and Kiribati to strengthen WASH in health care facilities and government monitoring structures, and in Solomon Islands for Community-Led Total Sanitation activities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/12/2017

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Community-based hand-washing behaviour change Communication programme implemented on a national scale
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existence of cluster coordination mechanism for WASH
Percentage of schools in target province with available WASH facilities that operate at the national minimum standards
# PICs where over 50% of the rural population use improved sanitation

actual.value: 2016:11 PICs Cook Islands, Fiji, FSM, Marshall Islands, Nauru, Niue, Palau, Samoa, Tokelau, Tonga, Tuvalu

title.narrative: # PICs where over 75% of the rural population use improved water supply

actual.value: 2017:11 PICs Cook Islands, Fiji, FSM, Marshall Islands, Nauru, Niue, Palau, Samoa, Tokelau, Tonga, Tuvalu
